<_io.BufferedReader name='Status Report as of 26 October 2016.pdf'>

Latest News/Facts Matter 

The OSCE Special Monitoring Mission to Ukraine (SMM) reported that violence levels fluctuated but remained high, with hundreds of ceasefire violations recorded on a daily basis.



Violence was concentrated around the following hotspots:

areas east and north-east of Mariupol;

the Avdiivka-Yasynuvata-Donetsk airport triangle;

the western and northern outskirts of Horlivka;

and on the Svitlodarsk-Debaltseve road.

In Luhansk region the situation remained relatively calm.



SMM monitors could not verify that the sides have disengaged as the sides have failed to provide safe and secure access for the SMM. 

Nevertheless, during the monitoring teams’ daily attempts to monitor the three disengagement areas, the SMM noted some efforts towards disengagement.

The monitors have observed positions being dismantled in the Zolote-Pervomaisk area;

as well as some armed forces/formations and hardware being moved out of the Zolote-Pervomaisk and Petrivske-Bohdanivka areas.

Additionally, some demining was also noted.



At the same time, the SMM continued to observe weapons missing from storage sites as well as the presence and use of proscribed weapons in violation of withdrawal lines.



Learn how the OSCE SMM is monitoring the disengagement foreseen in the Framework Decision of September 2016 with the aim of contributing to a full and sustainable ceasefire in Ukraine at:

www.osce.org/ukraine-smm/275521
